PLEASE BUY THE GAME, YOU'LL THANK ME LATER#1: Furries   These "people" upload as much furry content to the workshop as they can. At least 50% of custom characters uploaded the Steam Workshop are these "fursonas" or whatnot. These bipolar toddlers are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ disturbing as well. I recall once joining a server with said characters and seeing something along "ohmygodddd it looks so hot XD" in the chat, no I am not exaggerating. Say anything that these neglected kids have a differentiating opinion on and they'll introduce you to their fast typing skills of "stfu" or the classic "YOU JUST CAN'T APPRECIATE THE FURRY COMMUNITY♥♥♥♥♥quot;. Furthermore, I posted this picture to the community hub:http://www.quickmeme.com/meme/366zzf (Furries everywhere)   Within half a week I was permanently banned from posting anything to the DST hub. And when I investigated by looking in the page source (They mods never specified why I was banned in the first place, funny) I found that I was banned for "Offensive content and Spamming". Neither of which is valid in any way at all. Most of the Furrys had the nerve to go on my profile and report a bunch of my other content. They managed to team up to take down all my Payday 2 posts, one of which had around 1,200 likes and was on the top Steam posts for about a week. To this day, a -year and a half- two years later my privileges are revoked on both hubs.Thanks, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.#2: Kids   I'm fine with kids playing games, i'm going to clear that up right now. But when you have 7-9 year olds playing online, always asking you for "flint pls" or spamming "xD" in the chat it admittedly gets annoying after awhile. (Thanks the Klei for not adding voice chat I haven't gone completeky insane from these kids.) This is fine however as they usually keep to themselves or just tag along with a friend, but usually this is not the case. Don't expect to come across any kids with respect for you or anyone. They also like to follow you around and steal your loot, that's cool too.#3: Griefers   Remember that game Minecraft? Well, in that game the multiplayer servers had 'Griefers'. These people would go around and purposely destroy other peoples creations. But in this, these people will play as the character Willow who starts off with a lighter, they will then go around and set everything on fire making most servers unplayable knowing that all the resources have been destroyed. Unless the existing players have some sort of plant and tree seeds stored away, the server becomes unplayable as it has no wood or food. This happens to most servers without some sort of anti-grief feature. Luckily, more servers are adopting new anti grief mods. So this isn't too much to worry about.#4: Stupid people in general   I'm not saying everyone is, but a good majority of people in the community are. From ingame people asking all the time "how 2 I get wood?/", and the community putting useless guides and discussions in the community, it's damn annoying.To start off, ingame you're most likely to come acroos flat out stupid players. For example, this one time I found a pig village (An uncommon group of buildings that are accompanied by lots of food) I ran about 5 minutes to get to it, and I found a lot of berries enough to last me a few days. I then grab the berries and start walking away. Sooner or later come across the owner of the server and he said to me, (and trust me these were just about his exact words) "wow you just took my berries" Banned from the server, why? Because I took "his" berries. This was on an open public server. This is an uncommon example, but i feel like this game appeals to "that" demographic of kids, y'know? Like the Roblox/Minecraft/Unturned kids. Extrememly toxic and malicious kids. And the Steam community is much worse. If you go on the DST Community Hub right now, you'll see many Guides and Discussions made by little kids who don't know what the term "proper english" means. To be completely honest I could write a book longer than the entite Hunger Games book trilogy complaining about how damned this community is. Take a look for yourself, you'll see what I mean.   There's my rant about why this community is horrible. If you're a decent human being who; doesn't jerk off to animals, you're over 12, nice to people, and has actually had an education. You should pat yourself on the back, god thanks you. But still avoid this game.(I'm guessing everyone's going to flag this for "offesive content and spam", right?)Edit: 08/24/16Day 568, people are still getting pissy.Edit: 01/14/17Day 721, people are STILL pissy. Still banned.

content:
Posted: November 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								Amazing game!You can play this multiplayer OR single player!While the content is somewhat lacking for solo play in comparison too Don't Starve, playing solo is still an option for those who may not want to buy Don't Starve AND DST.As for multiplayer, there is so much that can be done, if you and your friends are new to the game, start with default settings and just see how long you can last. The first time through you may get caught of guard by the winter, and die half way through, but that's OK!!! Death is a thing that happens ALL THE TIME in this game, but it's never a soul-crushing defeat. When you finally get it down to a science, cool, it's time to mix it up! When hosting a match, you can change up the settings, making certain resources more scarce or bountiful, change the duration of the seasons, or even the starting season ( if you want hard-core setting, try starting with winter, and making berries / carrots more scarce)You can change the spawn rate for certain beasties to make it more challenging or more noob-friendly.Now, my last positive thing to say about this game revolves around their idea behind public matches. one of the most frustrating things for me when it comes to multi-player games is dealing with port forwarding and hosting. Thankfully, these guys make hosting SUPER easy!!! you set up your server in their fancy-dancy host option, click play, and BAM, you're hosting a server. no portforwarding or anything, no headache, just easy-peasy fun. Good luck to everyone, and i hope that this shed any light on the game!

content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is great game to play with friends or for couples! It has a very Tim Burton-esque vibe for those who are a fan of things that are a mix of creepy, cute, and full of depth. My boyfriend, who is a much more frequent gamer than me (I haven't really played many video games in the past 10 years), bought this game for me. It's easy enough that I could get into it, but difficult enough that its about equally challenging for the both of us. I would definitely reccomend this game for friends who want to play a game together, but have different experience levels when it comes to gaming, and definitely to couples who want to play a casual game together. Don't be surprised, however, when this game has you stressing out all over the place, trying to get through the harsh winters and nights. There will always be new things that can kill you. It's still a lot of fun though, as long as you're up for a challenge. Happy camping!

You won't regret this purchase at all :)

content:
Posted: January 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								If you've played the original Don't Starve and have been aching to play it with your friends, or random people, I highly recommend this game. This game is a lot of fun when it's played with friends because you guys get to decide on what type of adventure you guys want to get yourselves into because you can edit the world to your liking. Whether it be a world with scarce resources, monster-filled environments, or with just plain, set-to-default settings, it's still very fun! As a veteran player, I really like jumping into random games people host because I like to "observe" what the other veterans do (like hunting Koalefants/Tallbirds for their meats) and what the new players are trying to do (like killing five spiders, two of which are Spider Warriors, with a pickaxe), which, I have to admit, is very entertaining the majority of the time. There are some times, ESPECIALLY when the Winter season comes, where you just wish everyone that joined the game you're in knows what they're doing, or just able to "pull their weight," because of scarce resources (many people make all sorts of personal tools and gear without gathering the materials themselves) and constantly dwindling food supplies (too many mouths to feed and not enough hunters). However, when your whole team DOES manage to make it past the first winter season, it's a very satisfying accomplishment.If all of what I previously said doesn't sound very appealing to you, then don't bother with the game. Frankly, if you like making a base JUST for YOURSELF, not liking the idea of being with other players, or just being antisocial in general, then you really wouldn't like the multiplayer addition to Don't Starve; this game is meant to be played with other people and working TOGETHER with said people (hence the emphasis on TOGETHER for DST's teaser), so you're seriously better off playing vanilla if you're just going to be antisocial in a social game. I don't want to sound mean, but it's the truth (at least it is for me).Even though the game is still in its Beta phase, it's very playable; the devs have done a great job so far and the updates just keep rolling in with fixes. Get it if you really want it, but if you can wait, then I recommend waiting for its official multiplayer release (around summer), of which is included (I THINK) in the original Don't Starve.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2016
												Day 28: Winter is approaching, we have a base with thermal stones, Science Machine, Alc. Engine, walls, a good 20 or so berry bushes, a fridge, some improved farms, me and a friend agree that we're set. All we need is some jackets and we're good to survive. My friend goes to hunt, I go to scavange the last few bits before we start our hibernation.Day 29: Things are good, I've gathered a full stack of berries and carrots, and my friends on a trail. We are making it through the winter.Night 29: The worst happens, it begins to rain. I should mention I'm playing WX, my friends playing Willow. I start taking damage from the rain and advise we make our way back to camp, but he's convinced he can finish his hunt in time.Day 30: Winter begins. It's raining heavy and we're both freezing. I'm back at camp and our thermal stones are cold. The fire is lit, but struggling. No sign of my friend, he's still on the hunt.Day 31: It's obvious he isn't returning, and the rain ain't leaving, so I start tracking him down, following the burned trees and picked berries. I'm gaining hope in finding him, but I take a dart. The rain already had me weak, and I drop dead, the thermal stones falling with me. Ironically, the rain stops right now.Day 32: My friend has looted me and is halfway back to base. It's here we decide to keep him alive through winter, and revive me once he's recovered sanity and health. He had make a jacket and all was good.Night 32: I still don't know what it was, all he said was he heard a thump, them bam. Our base has no walls, and the nightmares are attacking. He evades through a wormhole, but that only makes it worse. Day 33: Until I was able to be revived, I took a passtime of haunting everything I dropped back to base, and convincing my friend it'll be OK, and making inspirational speeches against death. Midway through the day, we're both dead.The world resets. We do it again.

content:
Posted: January 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								If you've played the original Don't Starve and have been aching to play it with your friends, or random people, I highly recommend this game. This game is a lot of fun when it's played with friends because you guys get to decide on what type of adventure you guys want to get yourselves into because you can edit the world to your liking. Whether it be a world with scarce resources, monster-filled environments, or with just plain, set-to-default settings, it's still very fun! As a veteran player, I really like jumping into random games people host because I like to "observe" what the other veterans do (like hunting Koalefants/Tallbirds for their meats) and what the new players are trying to do (like killing five spiders, two of which are Spider Warriors, with a pickaxe), which, I have to admit, is very entertaining the majority of the time. There are some times, ESPECIALLY when the Winter season comes, where you just wish everyone that joined the game you're in knows what they're doing, or just able to "pull their weight," because of scarce resources (many people make all sorts of personal tools and gear without gathering the materials themselves) and constantly dwindling food supplies (too many mouths to feed and not enough hunters). However, when your whole team DOES manage to make it past the first winter season, it's a very satisfying accomplishment.If all of what I previously said doesn't sound very appealing to you, then don't bother with the game. Frankly, if you like making a base JUST for YOURSELF, not liking the idea of being with other players, or just being antisocial in general, then you really wouldn't like the multiplayer addition to Don't Starve; this game is meant to be played with other people and working TOGETHER with said people (hence the emphasis on TOGETHER for DST's teaser), so you're seriously better off playing vanilla if you're just going to be antisocial in a social game. I don't want to sound mean, but it's the truth (at least it is for me).Even though the game is still in its Beta phase, it's very playable; the devs have done a great job so far and the updates just keep rolling in with fixes. Get it if you really want it, but if you can wait, then I recommend waiting for its official multiplayer release (around summer), of which is included (I THINK) in the original Don't Starve.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												Welcome to the multiplayer standalone version of Don't Starve, where you have one job above all else:DON'T STARVE TOGETHER.Now that you know, you can now:-Starve alone, if nobody's joining your server.-Survive together.-Die together.-Play with Randoms.-Play with Friends.-Make friends with Randoms.-Rage at your Friends.-"We were going to survive Winter, but then the fire nation attacked."-Get beaten to death with a Ham Bat.-Freeze because somebody thought it was a good idea to have a water balloon fight in the middle of Winter.-Go berserk because somebody ate all the food in the ice chest.-Think hound attacks will be easier.-Realize you forgot about laggy players.-Wonder if everyone is insane within the community.-Question how Tails the Fox, Engineer from TF2, Lucario, Steven Universe, Rin Kaenbyou, and someone named Glace to be in the same world.-Don't eat the wrong mushrooms!-Go on an adventure to try solve more mysteries.-Have all of the characters unlocked without the hassle of Adventure mode.-Wish for the Shipwrecked DLC within DST.-Have a war between Wilson's army of pigs and Webber's army of spiders.-Annoy your human companions with WX-78's quotes.-Have fun.-Have the worst time of your life.-Die. A lot.-Retry, again, and again.-"No, you can't regrow crops in the winter, you numbskull!"-PvP is annoying in this game.-Ooh, did I mention there's also Giants in this game too?-Being naughty has conseqenses, you know!-Hallelujah, it's rainin frogs! ...Wait, what?!-Run, run, run run! Run away!-Set up a 100 day challenge after figuring out you and your friends have no hopes of defeating this cruel game.Wow, you got through that, and not alone either! Nice job, keep on surviving!

content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is great game to play with friends or for couples! It has a very Tim Burton-esque vibe for those who are a fan of things that are a mix of creepy, cute, and full of depth. My boyfriend, who is a much more frequent gamer than me (I haven't really played many video games in the past 10 years), bought this game for me. It's easy enough that I could get into it, but difficult enough that its about equally challenging for the both of us. I would definitely reccomend this game for friends who want to play a game together, but have different experience levels when it comes to gaming, and definitely to couples who want to play a casual game together. Don't be surprised, however, when this game has you stressing out all over the place, trying to get through the harsh winters and nights. There will always be new things that can kill you. It's still a lot of fun though, as long as you're up for a challenge. Happy camping!

												Fun! Staying alive and not starve with friends is always more fun because of the shared suffering.You can share resources, food, anything. Combine tasks and divide your foodstock with a simple ctrl-click of the mouse. You can, but you don't have to.Take more risks and get killed. Build your empire of laughs and fingerpointing together with your closest mates. Run away from big birds together. Get crazy together. No really, you'll be saying "Here's Johnny!" before you know it! (The Shining ref)Get separated and see side screen icons on the edge of the screen showing you where the other(s) are. stray out too far and see the icons dissapear, go search for them, tracking your way back.Or stay together, because THAT'S THE NAME OF THE GAME !?10/10 would get f**ked up together again.

content:
Posted: March 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								Why DST? Because Klei knows how to arouse your inner sadist by decorating the terrain with skeletons of previous victims, one of which you will soon become!So, in summary...Watch your friends die one by one! Watch that one loner with a dark sword brutally murder you and your friends! Watch that same guy burn your whole camp down with a torch! Watch your gang of friends become a group of wandering ghosts, relentlessly haunting any flammable objects in sight in hopes of setting them on fire! Wish upon a shooting star, just don't stand still for too long! Fight off Deerclops! Fight off Deerclops with your friends! Run away from Deerclops as he murders all of your friends! Eat your friend's corpse! Express yourself through emotes! Make new allies! Convert those new allies into newer enemies! Become that loner with the dark sword! But most importantly, watch the time; the next hundred hours will be the quickest ones in your life. I present to you the highly anticipated game, Don't Be-that-one-guy. Together. Or something.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
Early Access Review
								             Don't Starve Together is a awesome addition to the origonal game, gameplay makes sense and survival is very fun. One of the biggest problems in the origonal game was that there was very little replay value once you have mastered survival, though with this expantion there is always something new to discover.             I anticipated multiplayer ever since I first play Don't Starve, and I have to say this is a great addon. I recomend this game to people who have friends to play with and people that have no friends(sry about that) because there are tons of servers you can join at anytime. The mod support for this game is very cewl and allows for players to play their way, with friends or not. I highly recomend this game if you are a fan of the origonal and want a new experience.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												First of all, i have been with this game for a very long time during early beta aswell as when they added a new charecter, This game is amazing. If you think you suck at this game or you think u arnt going to like it then try it, get good at it, if ur starting out get a couple of friends and host your own world. If u have gotten good at it and a bit bored with the game then get some mods in there! Mods are really helpful for beginners, like the No Death Penalty or Extra Equip slots. This game is honeslty ALL PROS, I am yet to see a con in this game, Its multiplayer, sigle player controllers work on this, its on sale while im writing this so its cheaper, you can make money off of selling items, its popular, There is always something u have to worry about making the game a bit challenging, it has fighting, bosses caves and custom worlds! If you have a bad spawn area you just move out of it to the next one! This game is TOP NOTCH, it is AMAZING. If you have a problem in this game and disagree with any of this comment on my profile and i will prove you wrong! The ONLY THING IS it DOES NOT DO SPLITSCREEN, they are working on that, give Klei a break people it litterly JUST GOT OUT OF EARLY AXCESS AND ITS AMAZING.                                                                        Hope you guys enjoy the game! And remember, dont starve!

content:
Posted: June 25, 2016
												My friend and I had everything. Fridges, farms, crockpots, and enough food for a lifetime.We were surviving the winter, no, not surviving, we were thriving through the winter.Life seemed great, everything was going well... until... it happened... the Deerclops...It was huge, towered above us. It came in and destroyed everything we'd spent our lives building. I watched as he ripped our base to shreds. I saw my life flashing before my eyes.After 36 days, our adventure was over... just like that. We haven't touched the game since.Great game would reccomend, 10/10.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								this game.... this. game. i have nicknamed it '99 ways to laugh at you and your friends dying'  (as opposed to the single player version '99 ways to die'). and its so addicting!!! x.x Seriously though, it looks cool, its a hell of a lot of fun to play and will quickly make you wonder how surviving 20 days can steal away so many hours of your time. Its artsy, burtonesque, steampunk look is brilliant,  the crafting system makes sense (well mostly.. not sure when the last time was i made waffles with twigs >.>), and the utter randomness of things at times just makes you laugh out loud ... or perhaps that's just the insanity kicking in.  Add to that the ability to die with friends, or sometimes because of them, and we get a great survival game that will appeal to nearly anyone with a sense of humor and the love of a challenge. Highly recommend it!! 10/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game really should be called, "You're gonna die sooner or later" because that's exactly what happens in this game. Why?- You can freeze to death.- You can starve to death.- You can die from insanity.- You can die because it's dark and you forgot a light source.- You can die for no reason other than you probably shouldn't have hit that beehive with an axe.Good job, you're dead. Now your survival partner(s) must try to revive you before they go insane. Oh? They're starving AND it is the middle of winter? Well, I sense a server restart in your near future.On another server, you could have PvP enabled. Oh good, you're starving but they have food? HAH, not anymore! Unless they kill you, or you lead a pack of very angry bees into your new "friend's" camp and you both die. The possibilities are endless, but sooner or later, you'll die anyway. It's inevitable, and that is why I'll keep playing.Is the game impossible? No, but does that mean surviving over 123 days makes you invincible? Nope, I still died anyway. Why? Lol... I accidentally lit myself on fire.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												Huh, they actually did cosmetics very well. KudosIf you like survival management type dealios this is probably what you wantPro:This game can be pretty spoopy, but in no way is it a horror gameSimple Steam MultiplayerVery enjoyable alone, with friends, or even strangersLots of content to explore (Surprisingly this is more updated than Don't Starve as of me writing this review)Straightforward craftingSteam Workshop modsCosmetic items don't require you to spend any money unless you buy them from the marketCon:There's no endgoal, perhaps in a future update they will have something so stay tunedNot nearly as challenging as Don't StarveIf you like what you see then go ahead and get it, if it's not your thing, whatever.

It probably makes it harder until you get the hang of it. If this so far seems like a negative, it isn't. I actually love this game. The fact that Don't Starve could only add multiplayer to make it better is amazing. This game is great singleplayer, but it gets even better...Together.

content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
												Don't Starve Together is a multiplayer standalone version of Don't Starve, with separate content being developed for it only. Developed by Klei, I found it to be a wonderful experience overall, but of course, multiplayer games are not without their kinks.Let's start with gameplay as usual. Don't Starve Together, as per its singleplayer predecessor, is a survival game with crafting and obtaining resources. Unlike most standard subpar survival games, the way it does this is rather unique in the environment and resources that you utilize. Let's get this out of the way: You will die. Several times probably. But unlike the singleplayer version, you can have other people help you learn the mechanics of the game. The modes of multiplayer can't really be boiled down to essential basics, as factors such as being able to hurt other players or not, or if players decide to be loners or want to team up and create bases will affect how the game will play out. As for more of the game mechanics themselves, they tend to be better off learned through experience or reading it up on the dedicated wiki regarding the game.In terms of graphics, this game presents a rather well-done artstyle, looking entirely hand-drawn and with many shading effects looking scribbled in. As well, this game should run pretty well on most modern computers, and even some not-so-modern, although if there are many many entities on-screen, several computers will suffer some sort of framerate loss. Along with this is an entirely-cosmetic... cosmetic system. Players can earn drops by playing on a server for somewhat-variable amounts of time, for up to four gifts a week, resetting sometime on Thursdays. The time it takes between each of the four drops of the week increases as each gift is obtained and resets along with the gifts as well. Cosmetics are ranked in rarity, so the usually more-desired Elegant or Distinguished items will be rarer and generally cost more on the market. Also in place is a trade-up system and utilizing nine of the same rank of item can be taken and transformed into one item of a higher rank.In terms of sound and music, the sound design is also well-done. The sound designer did essentially all of the sounds themself in a practical fashion, which I find commendable in this day and age. As for music, Don't Starve Together features a selection of instrumental tracks which play during periods of working activity, basic mob combat, or combat against large "boss" mobs, and variations dependant on the season currently in place. I personally encourage those that grow to be a fan of the music to find the album by Vince de Vera and Jason Garner and get that, although one will have to find the tracks added later elsewhere.Being a multiplayer game, I do stress that playing with others online can affect how you might feel about the game initially. Please do keep playing until you've had a proper and full experience! Thank you for reading my review, and if you do purchase this game, have fun! If you prefer a more isolated experience, you could opt to get the singleplayer version, Don't Starve, which also features a new DLC still exclusive to it, Shipwrecked!

												First of all, I would like to thank Markus the gay rattlesnake - a friend of mine who gave me a key to this game. The amount of fun I'm having with this game is enormous, it takes coorporative survival to a whole new level. Don't Starve is an amazing game already, but turning it into an experience you can share has to be the greatest Idea sinse RoG.This just takes you through so many thrilling moments. From following Koelefant tracks in the cold♥♥♥♥♥winter to trying to get a Tallbird egg while the other one distracts the herd. The only thing this lacks is the updates ahead, I absolutely recommend this game! After all, what's the fun in starving alone?

You can now divide up jobs amounst the players, gathering firewood, finding food, building the base, gathering manure, looking for biomes, you still never run out of things to do. content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								Don't Starve Together was released into Early-Access on December 15, 2014. I was lucky enough to get a beta key and I played before you could buy it. And I got to say, unless you have friends.... DON'T PLAY THIS VERSION. It seems everything is a little harder like enemies for instance. Then again playing with friends doesn't really help. It probably makes it harder until you get the hang of it. If this so far seems like a negative, it isn't. I actually love this game. The fact that Don't Starve could only add multiplayer to make it better is amazing. This game is great singleplayer, but it gets even better...Together.

												First of all, I would like to thank Markus the gay rattlesnake - a friend of mine who gave me a key to this game. Don't Starve is an amazing game already, but turning it into an experience you can share has to be the greatest Idea sinse RoG.This just takes you through so many thrilling moments. From following Koelefant tracks in the cold♥♥♥♥♥winter to trying to get a Tallbird egg while the other one distracts the herd. The only thing this lacks is the updates ahead, I absolutely recommend this game! After all, what's the fun in starving alone?

content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								Don't Starve Together was released into Early-Access on December 15, 2014. I was lucky enough to get a beta key and I played before you could buy it. And I got to say, unless you have friends.... DON'T PLAY THIS VERSION. It seems everything is a little harder like enemies for instance. Then again playing with friends doesn't really help. It probably makes it harder until you get the hang of it. If this so far seems like a negative, it isn't. I actually love this game. The fact that Don't Starve could only add multiplayer to make it better is amazing. This game is great singleplayer, but it gets even better...Together.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game really should be called, "You're gonna die sooner or later" because that's exactly what happens in this game. Why?- You can freeze to death.- You can starve to death.- You can die from insanity.- You can die because it's dark and you forgot a light source.- You can die for no reason other than you probably shouldn't have hit that beehive with an axe.Good job, you're dead. Now your survival partner(s) must try to revive you before they go insane. Oh? They're starving AND it is the middle of winter? Well, I sense a server restart in your near future.On another server, you could have PvP enabled. Oh good, you're starving but they have food? HAH, not anymore! Unless they kill you, or you lead a pack of very angry bees into your new "friend's" camp and you both die. The possibilities are endless, but sooner or later, you'll die anyway. It's inevitable, and that is why I'll keep playing.Is the game impossible? No, but does that mean surviving over 123 days makes you invincible? Nope, I still died anyway. Why? Lol... I accidentally lit myself on fire.

												Huh, they actually did cosmetics very well. KudosIf you like survival management type dealios this is probably what you wantPro:This game can be pretty spoopy, but in no way is it a horror gameSimple Steam MultiplayerVery enjoyable alone, with friends, or even strangersLots of content to explore (Surprisingly this is more updated than Don't Starve as of me writing this review)Straightforward craftingSteam Workshop modsCosmetic items don't require you to spend any money unless you buy them from the marketCon:There's no endgoal, perhaps in a future update they will have something so stay tunedNot nearly as challenging as Don't StarveIf you like what you see then go ahead and get it, if it's not your thing, whatever.

content:
Posted: August 1, 2016
												This game is just 10/10 For a ton of reasons here are some tops and consTops1 The game runs good in generall2 Fun coop gameplay3 Very challenging4 You can make money playing this game for FREE5 Just good in generalCons1 Sometimes in a klei hosted server a group of people can come on and vote kick you for no reason.2 Vote kicks are bs3 Just REMOVE VOTEKICKS ARELDYOk then you can also earn neat cosmetics for your charachters to wear sutch as pants shoes gloves even to backpacks and crockpots! And its tottaly FOR FREE its not like tf2 where you buy a key for 2.50 euros and get something worth 3 cents out of it No here you can littarly get a present pop up in the left of your screen then you just go to a sience machine BOOM you got yourself some new cosmetics (or extra cash) Yea you heared that right you can technicaly get this game for FREE by just buying it playing it and making the cash back from cosmetics! Like ive seen some 15 euro cosmetics on the market place of this gameThey also do fun little events where you need to solve a puzzle of some sort (at their website) and link it with your game you solve it you get anthor neat cosmetic!Thats all guys i rate this game 10/10 Its really worth your time YOU DONT EVEN NEED FRIENDS TO PLAY IT you can just go to a public server (or play alone ofc)Welp thats all for real this time i hoped i helped someone out Goodbye!

content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								Don't Starve Together. I remember I spent two whole days playing this, non stop. It's really fun! Infact I still play it today. I can't stop playing it. I love the atmosphere, music, players, enemies, magic (ESPECIALLY MAGIC :D), etc. The community also helps make this game even more fun by creating mods for the game itself. I would help create modss, though I am not good at that ._.There isn't anything I can really say about this game that is bad. Everything is so perfect! Though there is one problem. From my experience some of the ancient biomes are not in the game, no matter how many times you create a new world. I loved these biomes but they aren't in here. Or at least I have yet to actually get to one of them. So if that could be added. Awesome!Overall this game is a 9/10 for me.

If you think you suck at this game or you think u arnt going to like it then try it, get good at it, if ur starting out get a couple of friends and host your own world. If u have gotten good at it and a bit bored with the game then get some mods in there! Mods are really helpful for beginners, like the No Death Penalty or Extra Equip slots. This game is honeslty ALL PROS, I am yet to see a con in this game, Its multiplayer, sigle player controllers work on this, its on sale while im writing this so its cheaper, you can make money off of selling items, its popular, There is always something u have to worry about making the game a bit challenging, it has fighting, bosses caves and custom worlds! If you have a bad spawn area you just move out of it to the next one! This game is TOP NOTCH, it is AMAZING. If you have a problem in this game and disagree with any of this comment on my profile and i will prove you wrong! The ONLY THING IS it DOES NOT DO SPLITSCREEN, they are working on that, give Klei a break people it litterly JUST GOT OUT OF EARLY AXCESS AND ITS AMAZING.                                                                        Hope you guys enjoy the game! And remember, dont starve!

content:
Posted: April 15
												Well, alot of gag reviews but i'll try and make mine a bit serious.Don't Starve Together puts you in a radomly simulated world with various resources. The goal: Survive.Although that might seem easy, the game amps up in difficulty with anything from bosses to hounds that spawn periodicaly to ♥♥♥♥ over your run. The pros:Great game to play with friends, Laughs were, and will be had. Beautiful artistic design. Amazing survival simulator without being overly serious.Great modding community. Runs on any potato. Great diversity; you always come back.The cons:No real progression system, if you like quests, this isn't the game. Seems hard or unfair at times, although this changes with experience. The hounds are easily managable but for new players the seasonal bosses RoG (reign of giants) adds are just rediculous. Playing together makes the game harder in terms of food as all of it is split. Even with good internet it can be hard to get prestine connection, which is important for kiting. All in all Don't Starve Together is an incredible game, worth the price, especially if on sale. It can be a bit rough, but with a couple friends and the wiki, learning it stops becoming annoying but fun. The fighting mecaniques in the game are very odd when comming from something like Terraria or Minecraft but work very well. The game is overall extremely polished and offers at least 50 hours of play.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 21, 2016
												I've loved the art for this title since the base games inception and I promise that this version, while missing a few story features, still carries all of the love and charm.   In my opinion, ever since I played Don't Starve in alpha state on Google Chrome, I felt like it would be a fantastic co-op or even versus experience and the steam numbers don't lie, everyone loves Don't Starve Together!  Every character is unique and those specialties are even more colorful in multiplayer as you can take on different roles that you are suited for in your co-op or group play.   If you enjoyed Minecrafts vanilla survival experience but now want a much deeper and more challenging adventure, take the leap and jump into the world of DST!Note: from here on out (since launch) the base game and Don't Starve Together will have diverging content updates which means that there will be content not included from the base game and vice versa.Note: in the description it is called "expansion" but it is entirely a seperate game, you don't need the original game to play this. Note: for multiplayer it says (Co-Op) but you can't share screens and you need 2 versions of the game.Note: game uses Steam Workshop, so you can download tons of mods and that includes some modded in characters from the original game's new expansion "ShipWrecked".Note: difficulty is VERY high, but that is the "point" of the game of which is literally called "Don't Starve"...they mean it.Despite its challenge, I recommend this game for all ages and interests.  It's not unlikely to die your very first night playing the game, and then the second night, and then the third...but that is the point of the game and once you start diving into this dark and twisted world,  I promise you will find adventure as well as a new tickling, creeping sensation to jump once again through the portal into the Codex Umbra...FOR SCIENCE!

content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
First spawn in game. Starved. Died alone. And miserable.Second spawn. Starved. Died with a friend. Not so miserable anymore......N spawn. Not starved (too much). Died but got revived by friend. Friend died. I revived friend. We both died. Almost happy ending (no massage included). Will N+1 spawn for sure!Fun fact: have you seen a titan done in by frog rain? Is AWESOME!Also beware of nighttime Koalefant: horridly sounds like old people making out!Cool tips: always invite a poor, lonely, shriveling-under-the-winter's-winds Deerclops traveler in your base - is the humane thing to do. Beefalo in heat is the friendliest beefalo around, go pet it right now. Be a good host, offer nice meatballs (or any meats for that matter) to friendly cave-dwelling Bunnymen, they will surely appreciate you for it. Best time to visit Pigmen is under the gentle light of a full moon, super-fun guaranteed! Eat lots of rot to stay healthy, as Glommer goop is good for sanity, gulp on it like there's no tomorrow (and trust me, most of times nor will it be). Plus here's a hungry Spider Warrior to keep you safe! (if playing Webber take campy Warrior Pig instead) Friendship is magic and always ends well! *wink-wink*Conclusion: I uber-recommend this game, best multiplayer (subjectivity overload) tested so far! Even if burtonesque artwork is not your cup of tea, whimsical comedy, layered depth (tons of stuff to build, do, crazy mobs to whack and watch whacking themselves, friendly graphical interface, mods etc), assured entertainment and generally welcoming community surely will be. Still a small warning: it has a bit of a learning curve, but nothing that cannot be overcome with some practice and/or a good guide.PS: every week, playing the game like a maniac enough time, you get up to 4 skins[dst-skins-checklist.firebaseapp.com] (for characters, props etc) aka nice customization and/or marketable stuff - ole bonus of further game addiction!

content:
Posted: January 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								Think you've found yet another survival game? Guess again! This game will test you in many ways, are you cunning enough to save up for winter? Or brave enough to fight a giant monster that fills half your screen? Would you die for your friends? Well I'd figure as much. Don't worry though, you are prob'ly still new to the game when you read this so bear with me. When you start the game you can pick a character of your liking, some are better at adventuring, others will be good fighters, while others will shine more at building a proper base. Though some will pick Wess and make a lot of balloons. Anyways after you enter the Jury Rigged Portal you'll emerge yourself in the Don't Starve World, luckily your friends (if you have brought some) will join you in the same spot. The key thing is finding resources to craft with, if you don't craft you will not last long in this game. From an axe to a fire staff, much is possible indeed. You will start with collecting the nearest recources, see a lot of cute bunnies, bees and butterflies and maybe even some pigs. Though not everything you see will be friendly.. After spend the first day collecting you will have to make a warm fire to keep yourself warm and keep the monsters away. "Wait did he say 'monsters'?" Well yes I did, allthough it's better not to mention to much about them right now. I don't want to scare you, that's all.If you survive day 1 without burning, killing, starving yourself let me know. We should really play together sometime, I might learn a thing or two from you ;)Pro's:+ What's more fun then starving alone? You've guessed it, starving together!+ Original art.+ Stable connection, I've played fine with 4-5 people.+ You can host and edit your own server.+ High replayability, I've played over 90 hours and I'm still seeing new things and learn new tricks.+ Much updates, the developers work to make this game better each day!Cons:- Not for the faint of heart.- I'm scared of the dark.- Friends might rage sometimes.9.5/10

content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
Early Access Review



YouTube™ Video: Steam Review E31 Don't Starve and Don't Starve Together 

			Views: 179		

			Don’t Starve & Don’t Starve Together: Don’t Starve & its multiplayer component, Don’t Starve Together, is an indie sandbox survival game of the weird & mysterious variety.		

Don’t Starve & Don’t Starve Together: Don’t Starve & its multiplayer component, Don’t Starve Together, is an indie sandbox survival game of the weird & mysterious variety. Developed & published by Klei Entertainment. The gameplay is simple which is pretty common for Klei, the controls are nothing special which isn’t bad, the gameplay itself is mostly fun although I have some personal gripes with combat.But, first, let’s talk about the graphics, the game is an isometric 2.5D game, with this really intriguing dark pencil drawn art style, the fact that the world of Don’t Starve itself is this mysterious & weird world also lends itself to this type of art style. The music also reminds me of this sort of twisted carnival feel, with lots of weird strings & brass instruments used to set the tone, characters also speak with mashed up music tones from different instruments, sounding mostly unpleasant.So as it’s about survival, you’ll brave all the elements of the seasons, the ever present drain on your sanity & your belly grumbling. Don’t Starve also features plenty of dangerous creatures as well as some neutral ones ranging from the Pigmen to the aggressive fish like Merms & of course with the Reign of Giants DLC, Giant boss monsters like the Deerclops. It’s a pretty challenging game, don’t expect to survive very long with your first forays into Don’t Starve, you’ll die plenty of times but, never unfairly so, as you learn the game you will become a better survivor & the game rewards you for how long you survive by unlock more characters to play with a total of eleven to choose from all with their own strengths & weaknesses. The story of Don’t Starve is only accessible through the sandbox mode which you start in, if you wish to know how to get there, you’ll have to experiment to find out.My only real gripe is with the games ‘combat’, you interact with the world mainly with the mouse, you can hold the spacebar to pick up nearby objects which is really handy, you can use the mouse or keyboard to move around, but, when in combat, I only ever was able to use the mouse, this is a problem, since the world is flat it is very easy & common for things to get in the way. This is only exasperated when things are hectic, it’s very annoying when there is multiple enemies. There are several ways to avoid combat, but, when you must it’s a pain dealing with multiple enemies at once. Other than that gripe the game is just pure fun, the multiplayer part was so simple to setup I can’t find anything to complain about, it’s the whole single player game with friends up to six & it’s easy to use plus you get two copies for the one price so it’s pretty cheap. I personally love Don’t Starve, it was a bit to get into at first, mostly because I was failing a lot at the beginning, but, once I gave it a serious shot I began to get better & better & could survive a very long time before dying, if you like survival type games in general definitely check this out, if you don’t like a challenge, or don’t like indies (for some reason) or just don’t like things that aren’t 3D ultra-graphics & “realistic” then steer clear of the quirky world of Don’t Starve, for the rest, we’ll be trying to survive despite the odds. Its $14.99 USD which is a pretty good deal, I’d recommend getting the bundle with the Reign of Giants for $18.99 USD which will give you a ton of stuff, or get the bundle that comes with a copy of Don’t Starve Together which includes the Reign of Giants DLC & bring a friend along for the ride! Thank you Klei Entertainment for awesome deals on awesome games!TL/DR; Don’t Starve is a wonderful survival game that doesn’t take itself too seriously but does offer a serious challenge for new comers. It’s got a very unique art style. The game is simple to play & simple to run with the sandbox goal of ‘survive’, it holds no hands & still expects you to succeed, it’s a fun game, & its multiplayer component Don’t Starve Together makes the experience even better with the ability to bring friends along for the suffering. I highly recommend check out both titles, they offer good deals for the single & multiplayer experience, unless you can’t stand the look of the game, or need that “realistic” approach to survival then check out Don’t Starve & Don’t Starve Together! -Double Thumbs Up from Royial

content:
Posted: August 21, 2016
Klei made Don't Starve even better with Don't Starve Together!This is a multiplayer game, and in my opinion the community is what really makes or breaks the experience. For new players, please refrain from using phrases like, "Where is base?" the moment you enter a server. We know that you are new and we are more than willing to help, but please understand that this is a game where you learn and build upon your mistakes. Instead, ask for tips on what to do and what to prepare for and try to survive on your own! Veterans will respect your curiosity and independent attitude. These are the type of players we want to build a base with since we are all able to take care of ourselves.Also, realize that this is a slow paced game in the sense that you will have to commit a lot of time just to experience everything. To even complete a full cycle of the seasons will take you hours, with many challenges along the way. More often than not, players who are unprepared for the obstacles will end up dying multiple times in a course of a play through. With that being said, go out there, explore, be curious, have fun, and most importantly, don’t starve!

content:
Posted: July 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								What makes a great game like Don't Starve better? Why playing with friends of course. Journey into the world of Don't Starve with up to 5 friends in Don't Starve Together. This standalone expansion brings with it a whole new style of play to explore the strange and wonderful world of Don't starve.If you are not familiar with the gameplay of Don't Starve, the concept is simple. Your character is dropped in the middle of a strange wilderness and you must use your wits and whatever else you may have brought with you to survive. Don't starve Together removes some of the story of the original, but the basic concept remains the same. You, and your friends, are dropped through a portal into a random area of the procedurally generated map. You are immediately tasked with finding the basic resources to survive. With the day and night clock running, you need to do so quickly before the darkness sets in, and you are relatively helpless.This is where the sense of balance from the original game can sometimes feel off. The original game has enough resources scattered around the spawn areas for you to usually be okay the first night or two so long as you are careful. You have only one mouth to feed, and a small pool of skills to use depending on which character you have unlocked, and in play. With Don't Starve Together, you are open to choosing from among the entire cast of eclectic characters from the original game, and the DLC, Reign of Giants. This early access to all the characters gives an interesting chance to mix and match various skills together to see if they can coexist. This process however is often hit and miss, as the resources available early on, are much different than what you would find in the single player game. This often means that you spend a lot more time harvesting basic items like food, as you need to travel farther to collect enough for two or more mouths to feed.When you do find a good balance of skills between your characters the game shines. For instance mixing Wigfrid's combat skills and good starting armour with Wickerbottom's smarts allows you to quickly build an advance base and defend if you work together well. And yes, all the playable character's names start with 'W'. Pick the wrong combination however, and even good teamwork can lead to frustrating death, upon death.Really though, this game is meant to be played with friends. The game worlds available to drop into are varied, and many run with different settings and mods and figuring out how to survive with strangers, or just avoid them and make your own spot in the world has it's moments. When it comes down to it however, the best aspect of Don't Starve Together is going in with a group of friends and experiencing the weird and wonderful world. With a good set of friends, the general wit and humour of Don't Starve, it's impossible not to have fun, even when one of your friends accidentally dies after running directly into a wolves den, or opening a mysterious chest that suddenly begins winter.Graphically there is no difference between either version of Don't Starve. Don't Starve together however includes the full content of the original game's DLC as well as some new items, creatures and biomes to explore. The game runs relatively smooth, with only a minor amount of lag up to the 6 player limit. Though it is possible to allow more players onto a server, the game becomes unplayable due to lag, and latency issues.The Dev team at Klei Entertainment are quite active, and as this game is still officially in beta I am sure they will iron out the balance wrinkles. They may even be able to expand past the 6 player maximum. If you enjoyed Don't Starve, there is absolutely no reason why you won't enjoy Don't Starve Together. For new players to the game, it gives a unique opportunity to work with others to learn the mechanics, or have a friend help you start off. Overall this is a great addition to this game's universe and I can't wait to jump in with my friends and play some more.

												Don't Starve Together, hmmm, what to say about something as simple as not starving? Oh wait! I know!! This game is actually really fun to play, work together with friends to survive a fun little worlds full of creepy monsters and night time hours that kill you if you do not have a light source. Surprisingly you can die really fast in this game even if you bump up the resourses of your server. Pkus what else makes this game amazing is the modding community. Some mods you can just scroll past and forget exist but most of the mods on the community are amazing and can bring more life too the already great game.I highly recommend this game to pretty much anyone

content:
Posted: December 3, 2015
Early Access Review
 Facts	You start as one of the characters who have their own special abilities, perks and stats. You start near a gate in the middle of nowhere. You'll have to gather a bunch of stuffs and know how to hunt animals, use traps and know how to farm in order to survive easily. But if you f*ck one thing up, you'll have to restart from the beginning.  Or just find a way to respawn.	 My opinions	In my opinion, it's fun but a bit repetitive. It's better if you play with friends WHO KNOWS how to make good decisions and knows a lot about the game but of course you and your friends can start together and learn about this game together. The default settings is too hard for you. You can change it if you don't mind it. Personally I won't be satisfied if I make the game easier with the world customization but there's a lot of things that are pretty dissapointing in the default settings like for example,  hound attacks happens too early and they're too hard to defeat if you have no viable weapon to use to kill them,  After an hour of building your survival camp, you still can die at any moment. You'll have constant pressure from everything like Hunger, Sanity, hound attacks, rain and the fact that you have to do everything at once. And what if you forgot to do one thing and something is coming to you? You'll be screwed and in order to not waste any more time, you'll have to re-create a new world and try again or just try and fight back if you don't take games too seriously like me... Verdict	I rate this game [.68 / 1] personally... But if I can only rate this game by the quality of it and not involve my personal opinion about it, I would rate it [.89 / 1]. This is why I recommend it. I don't like it as much as the average players do, but I sure do know a lot of you will like it.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game... Wow.It's awesomely fun.Characters are in-depth, experiences are all different... Man.To truly explain why I enjoy this game, here's a little story:So my friend, I'll just say X, had been playing for, eh, an hour or two. We never got passed day 4 since we suck.So X dies on day 1. For fun, I decided to continue playing. After 4 rough days of survival, things were going alright...Until I forgot to build a fire fast enough.Suddenly, I get smacked three times. Due to my characters low HP, one more smack would destroy me. I quickly equipped a torch. Due to my damage taken at night, I had now lost all sanity. Things got spooky. Like really spooky.I somehow survived for three more days with one HP and low sanity... But the last day was when I died on purpose out of pure fear.As night descended, I quickly built a fire and waited there. Eyes were blinking all over the shadows. I had done this twice, so I didn't think it could get worse. But boy was I was wrong. Suddenly, creepy music began playing, like something from an old music box. This shadowy hand then extended itself from the shadows, reached over to my campfire, and suddenly my fire went out. Daytime then arrived.Literally super scared, I found a shadow monster and let it kill me to end the terror.I'm now super determined to never go insane just because of that. Was... spooky for sure.

content:
Posted: February 4
												I've never been good at writing anything, so here goes my first serious Review.To the point: This game is good if you like having big goals/ or would like to make friends. 9.5/10-FRIENDS-I've made many friends in this game, some of them are even my besties now. A friend introduced me to this game, a friend helped me through this game, and a friend showed me to a group of friends I will never forget. This game will enhance your best experience with friends as you fight, survive, and thrive in the wilderness.-GAMEPLAY-Don't Starve Together is a classic survival with many challenges. I'm sure you know most of the basics like "don't starve, don't eat this, and don't hug the shadow right? Let's skip that. There is a lot more to surviving than building spectacular bases, raiding the ruins (Mid-Endgame stuff), creating farms, and setting goals. There comes a time however when Don't Starve Together gets repetitive. You could fix that with the large amount of mods available in the Workshop, or try to set goals for yourself. Here, I'll give you some to work with...-Raid the ruins by winter.-Fight all the bosses in a run.-Set Tusks to more or lots.-Long term Ruins base.-Build a huge wall separating a piece of land.-Play PvP with friends or strangersHOWEVER... HOWEVER HOWEVER HOWEVER...This game has faults as well. As you know, some people are complete bum bums, and they try to ruin the fun like in most multiplayer games. This game has griefers. These terrible little creatures are fueled by the salty tears of the people who got their base ransacked by these little demons. Basically they can burn your base to ashes, smash it to pieces, steal, destroy, and just tear it apart with ease. There are also other types of bum bums which are very rude to others. This community is not perfect, but the risk makes it worth the reward.Now if you're planning on buying this, you should probably know some Don't Starve Together gamer terms.PK - Pig King (The Gold giver)DF/DFly - DragonFly (Boss of the desert)Griefer - Despicable creaturesKiting - Dodging an enemy and hitting it too.AG - Ancient Guardian (Boss of the ruins)Deer - Literal Deer, not Deerclops.Tstone - Touchstone (A 1-up basically)Quarry - A biome full of rocksMosaics - A mix of turf and biome. Usually includes a rock biome inside and a pet cave.PK Forest - The Forest surrounding Pig King, Autumn colours.Roll - To roll a die. do '/roll' and you can roll a number between 1-100. You may edit this as well. For example: /roll 10D10000. The maximum roll you can do.My goal for this review is to get you ready for this game, and hopefully I succeeded in that.

								Don't Starve Together is still a work in progress, but it's quite stable and much, much, more fun playing with friends! The mod system isn't perfect and some players can't use certain mods unless your the host of the server. There aren't many mods in the workshop yet either, but more will be added in time. This is comparing to the originial don't starve mods so it's actually not bad at all. There are lag problems which led to many restarts, but overall it's stable enough to play and lots of fun! I Highly reccomend this game. It will only get better with the daily patches.

content:
Posted: March 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								อย่าหิว... ด้วยกัน.... ตัวนี้เป็นรีวิวพิเศษที่จะไม่มี ส่วนของ Story ครับ เพราะเกมเน้น Multiplayer โดยจะไม่มีคะแนนของเนื้อเรื่องสรุปตอนท้าย..-Gameplay---------------------------------------------------------------ตัวเกมนั้นนับได้ว่าถูกพอร์ทมาจาก Don't Starve ตัวหลักเลยก็ว่าได้ โดยเกมจะไม่เพิ่มอะไรไปมาก และ ตัดบางสิ่งออกเพื่อให้ตัวเกมนั้น เหมาะกับการเล่นแบบผู้เล่นจำนวนมาก ซึ่งนี่ก็ได้กลายเป็นดาบสองคมของเกมนี้ไปเลย โดยที่เกมเพิ่มระบบผู้เล่นหลายคน ทำให้ผู้เล่นที่มีปัญหาทางอินเตอร์เน็ตต้องเจอปัญหาหลากหลายรูปแบบ ถึงเกมนี้จะมีระบบที่ให้ผู้เล่นสร้างห้องกันเองก็ตาม แต่เกมนั้นก็ยังต้องการ Host ที่มีอินเตอร์เน็ตเสถียรเช่นกัน ซึ่งจะก่อให้เกิดปัญหา "Bad Host" ซึ่งผู้เล่น ในห้องจะเกิดอาการดีเลย์ทั้งๆที่เน็ตตัวเองไม่ได้ปิงเยอะรึมีปัญหาอะไรเลย แต่ในเมือเกมเพิ่มระบบนี่มา มันก็ทำให้เกมดูมีสีสันโดยคุณกับเพื่อนจะช่วยกันหาของรึสู้กับมอนสเตอร์ได้ง่ายขึ้น แต่ในทางกลับกัน สิ่งของก็จะมีจำนวนที่ต้องจำกัด และ แบ่งผู้เล่นอื่นตามๆกัน นับว่าเพิ่มความยากของเกมมาได้หลายเท่าเลย ใน Don't Starve นั้นหากผู้เล่นตายก็จะเป็นอันสิ้นสุดแต่ใน DST เมื่อคุณตายของคุณจะร่วงและคุณจะกลายเป็นวิญญาณ ซึ่งจำเป็นต้องให้เพื่อนร่วมทีมของคุณชุบชีวิตขึ้นมา และถ้าหากปล่อยให้เป็นผีแบบนั้น เกมก็จะดำเนินยากขึ้นเพราะมันจะลดกำลังในทีมไปได้ส่วนหนีง นับว่าผู้พัฒนาเกมได้ทำให้เกมดูร่วมมือกันตามชื่อ Together จริงๆ-Graphic-----------------------------------------------------------------อย่างที่รู้ๆกันว่าเกมนี้มีภาพ 2D ที่เป็นภาพวาด ซึ่งไม่ว่าใครๆก็คงเล่นได้ และไม่มีปัญหา แต่ว่า เกมนั้นยังมีปัญหากราฟฟิคที่แย่อยู่ เวลาที่คุณต่อสู้กับมอนสเตอร์จำนวนมาก รึมีการทำแอ็คชั่นในแมพนั่นมาก เฟรมเรทจะตก ซึ่งเรื่องนี้มันก็ไม่แปลก แต่ว่าเมื่อเวลาผ่านไป ทั้งๆที่เกมไม่ได้มีแอ็คชั่นอะไรมากมาย แต่เฟรมเรทมันก็ยังตกอยู่อย่างนั้น ซึ่งปัญหานี้จะพบกับ Host ซะเป็นส่วนใหญ่ -Verdict------------------------------------------------------------------โดยรวมแล้วเกมได้เปิดมิติเกม Survival ที่ไม่เหมือนใครอย่าง Don't Starve ให้มาช่วยกันหิวได้ และเกมยังมีระบบ mods ที่ให้ผู้เล่นโหลดมาใช้มากมาย ถ้าคุณชอบ Don't Starve อยู่แล้วก็อย่าลังเลเลยครับ ชวนเพื่อนมาหิวด้วยกันเลย ราคาเกมไม่แพงจนเกินไปและไม่กินสเปค แต่มีปัญหาทางด้านเชื่อมต่อ ก็ไม่เข้าใจเลยว่าเกมภาพ 2D นี่มันจะ Host ห้องมันต้องใช้เน็ตแรงๆ และ สเปคเครื่องถึงขนาดสูงเลยรึไง ! ! !

content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												First off, I never ever think anyone should buy any unfinished video game. Don't buy this game until the release comes out. Why? Because Towns, Starbound, Cubeworld, etc.I should also note that I left Don't Starve a very negative review, and I still stand by that review. Don't Starve was brutally hard, unsurvivable, and just not fun.However, Don't Starve Together is different.I think this game has a decnet chance of being great when finally released. With a determined group of starving friends, if everyone cooperates (and Willow doesn't burn everything down), you can gather enough resources and fend off hunger long enough to build a small base, set up some farms, and maybe survive winter. You can even have a little fun doing it.Don't Starve Together still has a long way to go from being a single player game to a good multiplayer game. There are significant technical issues which still need to get worked out. Development has also been painfully slow. I don't expect a final release for another 3-5 years. YEARS.PS: Remember when they said there would be no multiplayer? This is why those who say it can't be done should not be allowed to stop those who are doing it. Also why some people need to be slapped up the face.http://forums.kleientertainment.com/topic/4073-multiplayer/

content:
Posted: January 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								A little weird to me that you either wait for the launch of this game to get don't starve together, or get a free copy of it at launch when you own the game. These games typically are a bit weird because you never get an unfinished copy of it until it's done. However it is a quirky little fun game that's 2D. Typical old school point and click type game for movement where you point and click on floor. Movement is a weird because of the graphics and the character gets stuck or has problems moving around things at times in order to pick things up. Could use more work. The devs actually put out updates and fix things. They have been timely with caring and tending for their game. This is your typical survival game. You can actually beat it in adventure mode but it is very short and not much gameplay is offered there. You can build but it is very limitted. No roof's or shelters for you either. You can make things like umbrellas but you will never have true shelter other than building a fence. The fences are not durable and there are no gates available. It's a chore constantly breaking things to get in and out of your fenced area. Storage isn't good. Crafting storage takes a lot of wood and offers very little space. You end up crafting 30 or more just to keep your things stored. You can't really build too much and you can't rely on farming because in the winter nothing grows. You can survive from animals you hunt or stored rabits as well as other things here and there like birds. Provided, that you prepared and stocked up on items to survive. The game offers seasons which may or may not make things a tad more difficult due to weather changing. Food will spoil quickly even in a craftable ice box. I suggest storing rabits with traps you made to catch them in storage chests so you can avoid the spoiling of food through the winter. Each storage chest can hold up to only 9 items. The idea is get what you can and survive while preparing for winter. Collect and gather resources and craft items to survive or play adventure mode and survive. At night if no light is made by you, you will die and just about anything else can kill you as well. Fun for a few hours but not enough to keep you busy for months. I pop in and out of it as new things become available. Several mods for this edition of the game as well as the original version of the game. Recommended for short gaming sessions for those who want a much easier and funnier survival game. There are ways to avoid death by crafting armor or touching a touching stone or getting supplies to make magic items non stop that can aid you to stay alive. But if not prepapered you will die and have to restart your game again as there is perma death. However in this version of the game you can come back to life if you have your settings set for that. This version is almost the same as the original version of the game but allows for playing with other people you pick or with randoms. You can very easily play with other people with little to no hassle or set up on your end. You do not need to deal with port forwarding settings which makes this co-op experience more attractive to newbies. Their wiki for the game is a bit weird to use and no search bar is even provided so I suggest just reading forums or talking with their community for help or ideas. Although it is not really needed as they game shows you what you can and can not craft. Making it so much easier rather than playing a survival game where you have to be glued to a wiki page because the game failed at teaching you anything or showing you what you could and couldn't do. I am really liking the games that clearly show you what is going on and what you can make. Enjoy! :)

content:
Posted: April 23, 2016
												Although not for everyone, Don't Starve Together is a masterful combination of art and gameplay. By adding multiplayer to their largely successful title "Don't Starve," the original becomes better than ever before.As I mentioned, this game is not for everyone. People who enjoy shooter games will not find joy in playing this game. It's a game that requires patience and good habits (checking your food, health, sanity.) As a casual gamer, I find this game to be a blast. It's exiciting and fun, and each time you start it up, it's a brand new experience. I know that I will be playing this game a lot in the near future.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 25, 2016
												As someone who hasn't played the single player version that much I still wholeheartedly recommend this game. You are going to get the most out of it with at least three friends. Talking and planning is essential here – maybe you will see your buddies in a new light after a few hours of a desperate battle against the many odds the game throws against you. Beware: human emotions tend to go haywire in dangerous situations. You'll know what I mean if you ever built – what you thought was – a reasonably stable ecosystem only to completely be bamboozled by some irresponsible action of a friend.Life will be tough but it's addicting. Especially together!+ realistic simulation of being lost in the wildernis with your friends. (=you die)+ lovely graphics+ the well goes deep: there's much to explore+ endless replayability+ intuitive gameplay (this one's a must)+ stuff gets patched and refined regularly+ you can burn forests!- main menu is a bit confusing to use with the controller- you may lose a friend or two- you can burn your campNomitated this game for the “Best Use Of A Farm Animal” Award.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								I think this game will be amazing when it's ready for release. The Beta is doing so much better, performance and content -wise than I had hoped. It's all the horror and danger from before, but with the advantages of sending your husband to fetch cut grass for you while you set up camp. Then again, you might play with strangers and wonder why they plant trees right on top of your campfire every time you cut them down, or why they go AFK long enough to starve to death and literally drive you insane.All in all, the new dimension provided by other people is awesome. I can't wait until we can hit the caves. Maybe I'll finally get to do that Ancient stuff with someone around to watch my back?!Current con: ...the... lag. Rubberbanding when I play with strangers gets me killed. A lot.

content:
Posted: April 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								Ever wished Tim Burton was a game developer? Wish basically ♥♥♥♥ing granted. The art style, the monsters, and the creepy little sayings you'll observe in this game are very reminiscent of the whimsical creep master and his amazing films. Have no idea who Tim Burton is? Well, first of all, how dare you. Second of all, you'll still love this game. There is never a lull in forward momentum. You will always need to be doing something, you will always be fighting for survival. Whether it's against starvation, monsters, the weather, or the darkness itself. Something will always be waiting to kill you. Always.In a word? Addicting.10/10.

												This is the absolute best isometric survival game that you can play with your friends, at least in my opinion anyway, just look at the average reveiws for recent and all time... overwhelmingly positive, that is making a statement on its own, but this game isn't easy, it really ain't, dont go into it thinking that it wont be that hard, at first you are only likely to last 3-7 days, and then when you have properly learnt the game, 20+ is normal, the mods are great (although most of the character mods look♥♥♥♥♥♥because they are in a differant art style to the game, which is really dumb on the artist/author of the mods) i have only ever crashed once in 40 hours and that was because of a broken mod (stackable rabbits just in case you wanted/needed to know) but i got back in the game and just disabled it and it worked fine again. if i could, i would force people to play this if they like survival games. :steamhappy:

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								This games lived to be miles above my expectations. With an extraordinary art style, unique game play and tactical thinking. You're not only trying to survive but you're trying to beat your own preious goals each time you begin a new server. Every day that passes you and your friends scurry off trying to gather as many supplies for the winter (and days ahead) and hope that your base is in a safe enough spot. The multiplayer element really makes the game just as enjoyable as the single player version. With friends you're able to set goals and tasks to each person and team up in combats. PVP is a "hunger games" like experience. Seeing another player is frightening but an opportunity to team up and take on the server.Modding for this game is highly accessible and easy to implement. The host of each server controls modding, so whatever mods they have installed, they will be the only ones avalible to use. Un-modded servers are available, however if you havn't played the single player version of Don't Starve I wouldn't recommend joining any un-modded serves. The game requires some getting used to and practice.As you explore this vast land you'll encounter creatures, friendly beasts, mysterious entities and wonderful and scary abilities of Mother Nature and the human body. Highly reccomended, good luck and Don't Starve.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								Hello everyone, this reveiw is not just speaking of my opinion of this game, but my mates as well!Don't Starve is one of many of our favorite games on PC/Steam. We were having lots of fun with this game until one day: Don't Starve Together Beta confirmed everyone! As soon as the game was open to the public we received it for we already had Don't Starve. We were so happy that this happened, I didn't start playing until some of my m8's wanted to play. So I started hosting a game and we're having so much fun 7 hours into the game. We've also got mods on it to make it even beter! Since it's still in Beta it is a little buggy but we're okay with it. It took me a little while to make and account because the Email wasn't received till later the day I signed up. But we got there in the end, the mods we've downloaded helped with some issues with lag and glitches, and we also got some of our old favorites from the original Don't Starve so we're pretty happy about that.At times can be a challenge but yet a simple game, I'm not yet used to the attack style of the game yet but I'll get there, I'm more used to first person shooters, but I'm not gonna go there.... You choose a charecter and spawn in to a brand new world, your arn't yet to know what is expected to happen, but around the 9-10th night be ready, for there is a band of wolves that will come your way! Also to fans and friends and other people the game dosen't take that much to run, easy to handle and a great game! I will also be recording this game with some mates after some time in the near future, so be sure to check that out when I do. Thanks for reading and I will leave a little ranking of the game below! I rate/rank this game 9/10 for now, when all the glitchy stuff is fixed and it is out of Beta I will be giving it higher! =)

content:
Posted: September 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								After I load into the world, camped up next to a large campfire which my character describes as, “Glad it's contained”, I notice the amount of food has decreased. I update *John when he spawns in and begin my hunt.After catching four rabbits by simply chasing them into traps, I make my trek back to base. As soon as I begin cooking dinner, however, my character begins worrying, “The puppies are coming”. The puppies he’s referring to aren’t young and cuddly. In fact, they are a hungry pack of wolves, or hounds (as they are referred to), and they caught our scent. John recalls a herd of Beefalo, yes Beefalo, and as soon as my delicious meal is done, we got to stepping. About 15 seconds later,  four shiny-black-furred wolves with unnecessarily huge jaws caught up and begin snapping at us. Our feet soon hit the plains, and start making a pleasing sound, like someone walking on hay. We spot the herd and steer ourselves that direction, while the hounds busily snap at our ankles, determined. When John and I disappear inside the herd of Beefalo, the hounds switch their targets to the six or seven vegetarian four-leggers. But the pack of predators are soon brutally killed by the might of Beefalo. We, the spectators, occasionally and casually pick up the meat from the maimed corpses. Once it is all done with, John and I return home, satisfied with our newfound food. We fill our bellies with meaty stew and make use of the night, resting on straw mattresses.I am awoken by the cold of the air. I straighten up and take in the new surroundings, winter! The grass and trees, now pure white, have a new mood. The rabbits and frogs also have on their winter camouflage. I quickly fuel the fire with a grass tuft, which burst the fire into flames. I placed two thermal stones last night, and one is missing, presumably John took his.  While I shove a winter coat and hat on (which I have been saving for the past couple days), I notice a trap, moving. I walk over and “check” it. A lovely blizzard-colored rabbit pops into my inventory. Lunch!While I pick berries nearby, an idea slips into my head. I gather manure from the friendly herd of Beefalo and Man-Pigs (gross!) and some stick, seeds and grass. I chose to build the “Advanced Farm” and install it outside our home’s walls. I plant a seed and fertilize it twice. Boom, a carrot!. Pop, an eggplant. Blam, a dragon fruit!  I bounce to the crockpot and place the dragon fruit, eggplant, carrot and berries inside and press “Cook”. John arrives, with fresh meat and eggs after making “peace” with some irritating penguins. I give the dragonpie to my starving partner and update him about our new farm. I cook myself some bacon and eggs. We craft ourselves new tools and some chests for extra storage during the evening. John explains he found some tracks on his journey. I wonder what animal is on the other side as I lay down for bed. A koalefant, a lone Beefalo we can scavenge, or a danger Dragonfly maybe. There’s no telling what in store the next day in Don’t Starve Together...*Name Changed
